clinical_study.brief_title: Self-Management in African Americans With Diabetes and Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: Lifestyle Improvement Through Food and Exercise (LIFE): Self-Management in African Americans With Diabetes and Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: The primary aim of the study is to design a group-based, culturally appropriate self-management skills training intervention for disadvantaged African-Americans with both diabetes and hypertension and to compile an intervention Manual of Operations (MOO). The investigators are developing an intervention to assist individuals in reducing weight and hemoglobin A1c.

intervention.description: 18 group classes led by a dietitian and peer supporters, and weekly telephone calls by peer supporters. Intervention focus was on diet and physical activity.
2 3-hour diabetes education classes taught by a health educator at a local clinic
